publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-18 Robin Harper: That the Parliament recognises the widespread opposition to growing genetically modified crops, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to urgently initiate legislation to be laid before the Parliament for an immediate open-ended moratorium on the planting of genetically modified crops in Scotland. Supported by: Kenny MacAskill, Duncan Hamilton

S1M-18 Robin Harper: That the Parliament recognises the widespread opposition to growing genetically modified crops, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to urgently initiate legislation to be laid before the Parliament for an immediate open-ended moratorium on the planting of genetically modified crops in Scotland (lodged on 2 June 1999). Supported by: Kenny MacAskill, Duncan Hamilton

S1M-18 Robin Harper: That the Parliament recognises the widespread opposition to growing genetically modified crops, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to urgently initiate legislation to be laid before the Parliament for an immediate open-ended moratorium on the planting of genetically modified crops in Scotland. (lodged on 1 June 1999) Supported by: Kenny MacAskill, Duncan Hamilton

S1M-18 Robin Harper: Genetically modified crops—That the Parliament recognises the widespread opposition to growing genetically modified crops, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to urgently initiate legislation to be laid before the Parliament for an immediate open-ended moratorium on the planting of genetically modified crops in Scotland. (lodged on 1 June) Supported by: Kenny MacAskill, Duncan Hamilton, Linda Fabiani, Irene McGugan, Roseanna Cunningham

S1M-18 Robin Harper: That the Parliament recognises the widespread opposition to growing genetically modified crops, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to urgently initiate legislation to be laid before the Parliament for an immediate open-ended moratorium on the planting of genetically modified crops in Scotland. (lodged on 1 June 1999) Supported by: Kenny MacAskill, Duncan Hamilton, Linda Fabiani

S1M-18 Robin Harper: That the Parliament recognises the widespread opposition to growing genetically modified crops, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to urgently initiate legislation to be laid before the Parliament for an immediate open-ended moratorium on the planting of genetically modified crops in Scotland. (lodged on 1 June 1999) Supported by: Kenny MacAskill, Duncan Hamilton, Linda Fabiani

S1M-18 Robin Harper: Genetically modified crops—That the Parliament recognises the widespread opposition to growing genetically modified crops, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to urgently initiate legislation to be laid before the Parliament for an immediate open-ended moratorium on the planting of genetically modified crops in Scotland. (lodged on 1 June 1999) Supported by: Kenny MacAskill, Duncan Hamilton, Linda Fabiani, Irene McGugan, Roseanna Cunningham

S1M-18 Robin Harper: That the Parliament recognises the widespread opposition to growing genetically modified crops, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to urgently initiate legislation to be laid before the Parliament for an immediate open-ended moratorium on the planting of genetically modified crops in Scotland. (lodged on 1 June 1999) Supported by: Kenny MacAskill, Duncan Hamilton

S1M-18 Robin Harper: That the Parliament recognises the widespread opposition to growing genetically modified crops, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to urgently initiate legislation to be laid before the Parliament for an immediate open-ended moratorium on the planting of genetically modified crops in Scotland. (lodged on 1 June 1999) Supported by: Kenny MacAskill, Duncan Hamilton
S1M-18 Genetically modified crops (lodged on 1 June 1999) Michael Russell*
